content: #300handmadehats worsted ribbed watch cap by suzanne ross-mantle this pattern is versatile--knit it longer and it s a watch cap with a brim that can turn up and keep ears warm knit it shorter and it s more of a skullcap to make the watch cap length in the immortal words of elizabeth zimmermann knit the ribbing until you re sick of it and then knit some more the #300handmadehats project is a hat drive to provide handmade gifts at the annual old town community alliance s christmas day community meal an event to serve a christmas day meal free for all in the heart of old town eureka in northern california these hats are intended for distribution to folks who may not have consist access to washing facilities so it s best to use durable machine washable fibers my go-to is lion brand wool-ease or a similar fiber content materials & gauge 1 skein lion brand wool-ease worsted weight 80% acrylic 20% wool us size 6 needles 16 circulars and dpns gauge 20 sts in stockinette = 4 optional us size 8 circular needles for casting on ​ pattern notes knitter beware while this is a simple ribbed hat the construction is just different enough to trip the most experienced of us up the hat is knit in a purl 2 knit 2 rib until it reaches the desired length and the decreases are worked at the beginning of the last knit rib of each of 7 sections not at the end or the beginning of the section the decreases are shallow which means that the body of the hat will get long prior to starting the decrease rounds when casting on i like to use a stretchy long-tail cast on and cast onto a larger needle the hat co 112 sts being careful to start the ribbing with purl stitches and being careful not to twist the knitting join in round and place marker pm and work round as follows p2 k2 to end of round for watch cap continue until body of the hat is at least 8 long for a skull cap work until body of hat measures 6 before working the decrease set up round decreases and finishing set up round *work 16 sts as established pm repeat from * to end of round decrease rounds *work to last 3 sts before m k2tog k slip m repeat from * to end of round repeat decrease round until 14 sts remain removing all m as this last round is knit final decrease round k2tog to end break yarn and thread tail through all live sts to bind off weave in ends and block as desired © 2019 suzanne ross-mantle not to be reproduced or knit for profit this pattern is a gift intended to be made as gifts for members of the knitter s community be cool dude
